headline: Executive Director at Ushahidi
summary:
Angela is a technologist, community builder and open-source software advocate who is passionate about building and using appropriate technology tools to create an impact in the lives of marginalised groups. She has over 10 years experience in software development, global community engagement, and non profit organisational management.

She currently serves as the Executive Director at Ushahidi, a global non-profit technology company that builds tools for democratising information, increasing transparency and lowering barriers for individuals to raise their voices. She previously served as the Director of Community Engagement, creating and managing programs for Ushahidi’s diverse global community.

She is also a co-founder of AkiraChix, a non-profit organisation that nurtures generations of women who use technology to develop innovations and solutions for Africa.

experiences.title: Community Building Director
experiences.description: - Strategy development and execution of engagement with members of the AkiraChix network- Curation and execution of the Annual African Women in Technology Conference, hosted by AkiraChix- Organisational strategy development, team management and fundraising

experiences.title: Director of Community Engagement
experiences.description: - Leads on strategy and execution of support and engagement with users and contributors of Ushahidi products globally- Leads in management, development and prioritization of user documentation of ushahidi products- Supports product development teams in provision and monitoring user feedback

experiences.title: Community Developer Liaison
experiences.description: Building and growing the Ushahidi technical community, as well as mentoring members of Ushahidi’s open-source developer ecosystem through technical documentation, and hosting technical events (online and in person).

experiences.title: Developer
experiences.description: Building web applications on the Ushahidi platform, and providing technical support to users of Ushahidi’s cloud based system, Crowdmap.

experiences.title: Software development + Space management Intern
experiences.description: Software Development – Development of a java application to print out membership cards with information encoded in a QR Code.Social media management during *iHub_ Events – Maintaining web presence through twitter, blog posts, live streaming and flickr.

recommendations:
I worked with Angela for more nearly 5 years as collaborators on many projects. I saw first hand the excellence and drive that Angela brings to all of her work. As an individual contributor, she went out of her way to discover clients and customers needs with sight visits, calls, and community meetings. 

As she ascended into the leadership team, Angela navigated the difficult waters of a growing organization with a legacy product and customer base. She helped bridge our historical work processes into more efficient workflows and management structures, while never compromising our core user base or our culture. 

I saw Angela work across cultures, time zones, and products to make Ushahidi its best both as a team and for its stakeholders. She proved herself as the lifeblood of the organization.

A skilled writer, incredibly kind leader, and community minded person, Angela has been a mentor to me and many others in Ushahidi even before taking over as ED. Since she took over as Executive Director, Angela and I have worked closely every day to deliver more value to our users and make Ushahidi better. She gave me the opportunity to shape the technology and product areas, and trusted me with leading the technology & support team. 
I could never have asked for a better boss; the trust she placed in me made it possible for me to do my job as CTO with confidence.  The Ushahidi team is lucky to have her leading. 
Angela has made Ushahidi more inclusive, more impactful, and just a better place to work all around. Over and over again, she has shown me her dedication to serving the organizations who need our services.  
I know I would be lucky to work with her again.
